page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area is situated to the east of Glastonbury at the foot of the famous Tor. In the south west corner of our area the land rises to 50m and in the south east corner is Pennard Hill, which rises to about 110m. For the most part the land is little above sea level and the northern section is typical Somerset moor. This land would originally have been drowned but is now drained (and has been since 13th century) and meadowed for dairy farms. The village of West Pennard lies at the foot of Pennard Hill. The main Glastonbury to Shepton Mallet road runs through the village and forms the southern boundary of our area.The road passes over the ancient Ponter's Ball. This is a ridge,it's exact purpose and date of contsruction are unclear but it was probably a fortification and a boundary line between villages.
